sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The pope's parliament, containing a pleasant and delightful historie, wherin are ... deliuered ... the paltry trash and trumperies of him and his pelting prelats ... : Whereunto is annexed an Anatomie of Pope Ioane, more apparently opening her whole life and storie. / Written by Iohn Mayo. Mayo, John, fl. 1607-1629.
[10], 42 p.
by Richard Field dwelling in the Blacke Friers neare Ludgate., Imprinted at London : 1591.
Signatures: A-F⁴, G². Title page contains printer's device (McK. 192). "The anatomie of Pope Ioane" (p. [29]-42) has special t.-p. Imperfect: stained, and with print show-through, and loss of text. Reproduction of original in: Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======

Mayo, John, fl. 1607-1629.
[10], 42 p.
by Richard Field dwelling in the Blacke Friers neare Ludgate., Imprinted at London : 1591.
Signatures: A-F⁴, G². Title page contains printer's device (McK. 192). "The anatomie of Pope Ioane" (p. [29]-42) has special t.-p. Imperfect: stained, and with print show-through, and loss of text. Reproduction of original in: Folger Shakespeare Library.
